message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.DB 

The paper deals with explainable recommendation systems, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several sub-fields of computer science. However, the most relevant sub-category is likely Information Retrieval (cs.IR), as the paper focuses on personalized recommendation algorithms that use implicit feedback from user reviews to generate explanations. Additionally, the paper uses deep learning techniques to model user-item interactions and aspect-level preferences, which suggests that it could also be classified under Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the granularity of explanations, which is a topic that falls under Natural Language Processing (cs.CL). Finally, the paper uses real datasets to evaluate the performance of the proposed model, which suggests that it could also be classified under Databases (cs.DB).
